snippet: Retailers use about 20 percent of the energy consumed by all commercial businesses, and they are the fastest-growing commercial category of energy users, according to the Department of Energy.
abstract: Large retailers are increasingly investing in technology to conserve energy, in part to compensate for reduced sales during the economic recession; alternative energy producers see the retail industry, which uses 20 percent of the energy consumed by all commercial business, as a crucial testing ground for their products.
lead_paragraph: Retailers use about 20 percent of the energy consumed by all commercial businesses, and they are the fastest-growing commercial category of energy users, according to the Department of Energy.

headline.seo: Retailers Seek to Conserve Energy to Cut Costs
headline.main: Meccas of Shopping Try Hand at Being Misers of Energy
headline.print_headline: Meccas of Shopping Try Hand at Being Misers of Energy
